verses.text: He shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet yarn, and the live bird and dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and in the water from a flowing source and sprinkle it on the house seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has purified the house with the blood of the bird, the water from a flowing source, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the scarlet yarn,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shall release the live bird into the open country outside the town. In this way he shall make atonement for the house, so that it will be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law for every infection of skin disease, for rash,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for mold on clothing or a house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for discoloration and a scab and a shiny patch—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give instruction about when it is unclean and when it is clean.
This is the law concerning impure skin disease and contamination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses and Aaron to speak to the Israelites and to tell them this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever a man has a discharge flowing from his flesh, that discharge is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law about how a bodily discharge makes someone unclean: Whether his flesh secretes a discharge or it has a blocked discharge, ⎣he is unclean. As long as his flesh has a discharge or his body blocks a discharge,⎦ this makes him unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any bedding that the man with a discharge lies on is unclean, and every object on which he sits becomes unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches his bedding must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever sits on any object on which the man with a discharge sat must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches the body of the man with a discharge must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man with a discharge spits on someone who is clean, that person must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any saddle on which the man with a discharge rides becomes unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who touches anything that was under him will become unclean until sunset, and whoever carries these things must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man with a discharge touches anyone without washing his hands, that person must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any clay pottery that the man with a discharge touches must be broken, and any vessel or utensil made of wood must be rinsed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man with a discharge has been cleansed from his discharge, he shall count off seven days for his process of purification, wash his clothes, and bathe his body in water from a flowing source; then, he will be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and come before the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall present the offering for them—one bird as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering. This is how the priest shall make atonement for the man in the presence of the Lord, from his discharge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man has an emission of semen, he must bathe his whole body in water and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any garment or leather with an emission of semen on it must be washed in water and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also if a man lies down with a woman and has an emission of semen, they must bathe in water and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a woman has a discharge of blood from her flesh, her menstrual impurity will last for seven days. Anyone who touches her will remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything on which she lies during her monthly period is unclean, and everything on which she sits becomes unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches her bed must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and anyone who touches anything on which she sat must wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the uncleanness is on the bed or on anything else on which she is sitting when he touches it, he will become unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man lies down with her, and her menstrual impurity comes in contact with him, he will be unclean for seven days. Any bed on which he lies will be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a woman has a discharge of blood for many days besides during the time of her monthly period, or when she has a discharge that lasts longer than her monthly period, she will be unclean for as many days as her discharge continues, just as she is during her monthly period.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During her discharge any bed on which she lies is to be treated just like the bed during her monthly period, and every piece of furniture on which she sits will be unclean, as it would be during the impurity of her monthly period.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who touches them will become unclean. Any such people must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she is cleansed from her discharge, she shall count off seven days, and after that she will be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons for herself and bring them to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall offer one dove as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering. This is how the priest is to make atonement for her in the presence of the Lord, from the impurity of her discharge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way you shall separate the people of Israel from their impurity, so that they do not die in their impurity because they defiled my dwelling place that is in their midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law for those who have a discharge: for a man who has an emission of semen by which he becomes unclean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for a woman who is not well because of her menstrual period, for anyone, male or female, who has a discharge, and for the man who lies down with a woman who is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron’s two sons, who had died when they approached the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Tell your brother Aaron that he must not enter into the Holy Place at any time he chooses by going inside the veil which is in front of the atonement seat that is on the ark. This is so that he will not die, for I appear in the cloud over the atonement seat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how Aaron shall enter the Holy Place: with a bull from the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a whole burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to wear a sacred linen tunic, with linen underwear covering his flesh, with the linen sash as his belt, and with his head wrapped with the linen turban. These are the sacred garments. He must wash his body with water and then put the garments on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the congregation of the people of Israel he shall also receive two male goats for a sin offering and one ram for a whole burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall present the bull for his own sin offering, to make atonement for himself and for his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall take the two male goats and stand them before the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron is to cast lots for the two goats, one lot marked “for the Lord” and the other lot marked “for the scapegoat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall bring forward the goat that received the lot “for the Lord,” to prepare it as a sin offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the goat that received the lot marked “for the scapegoat” is to be kept alive before the Lord, to make atonement upon it in order to send it off into the wilderness as the scapegoat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Aaron has presented the bull for his sin offering to make atonement for himself and for his household, he shall slaughter the bull for his sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he is to take a full pan of glowing coals from the top of the altar, which is before the Lord, and two handfuls of finely ground fragrant incense and bring them inside the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to put the incense on the fire before the Lord so that the cloud from the incense covers the atonement seat that is over the Testimony, so he will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger upon the surface of the atonement seat on its east side. He is also to sprinkle some of the blood seven times with his finger in front of the atonement seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall then slaughter the goat for the sin offering of the people. He is to bring its blood inside the veil and do with its blood as he had done with the blood of the bull. He is to sprinkle it on the atonement seat and in front of the atonement seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall make atonement for the sanctuary to cleanse it from the uncleanness of the Israelites and from their rebellions and all their sins. This is what he shall do for the Tent of Meeting, which dwells in the midst of Israel’s uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he enters to make atonement in the sanctuary, no other person may be in the Tent of Meeting until he has come out. In this way he shall make atonement for himself and his household, as well as for the entire assembly of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall then come out to the altar that is before the Lord and make atonement for it. He is to take some of the blood of the bull and some of the blood of the goat and smear it all around the horns of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With his finger he is to sprinkle some of the blood upon it seven times. In this way he is to purify it and set it apart from the uncleanness of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has finished making atonement to cleanse the sanctuary, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, he shall present the live goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron shall lay his two hands on the head of the live goat and confess over it all the guilt of the people of Israel and all their rebellions and all their sins. He is to put them on the head of the goat and send it away into the wilderness in the custody of an appointed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the goat will carry all their guilt on itself to a remote, desolate place, and the man will send the goat away into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron shall enter the Tent of Meeting, take off the special linen garments that he had put on to enter into the sanctuary, and leave them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall bathe his body in water in a holy place and put on his regular garments. Then he shall go out and offer the burnt offering for himself and the burnt offering for the people to make atonement for himself and for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall turn the fat from the sin offering into smoke on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who releases the goat designated as the scapegoat shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water. After that he may re-enter the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bull for the sin offering and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood has been brought in to make atonement in the sanctuary, shall be brought outside the camp. Their hide and flesh and manure are to be burned in fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who burns them is to wash his clothes and bathe his body in water. After that he may re-enter the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be a permanent regulation for you: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall humble yourselves, and you shall not do any kind of work, neither the native-born nor the alien who resides among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For on this day atonement will be made on your behalf to cleanse you. You will become clean from all your sins in the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a sabbath of complete rest, and you shall humble yourselves. It is a permanent regulation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest who is anointed and ordained to serve as priest in his father’s place shall make atonement, wearing the linen garments—the sacred garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall make atonement for the Most Holy Place, and he shall make atonement for the Tent of Meeting and for the altar. He shall make atonement on behalf of the priests and all the people of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This shall be a permanent regulation for you to make atonement for the people of Israel from all their sins once a year.
So Aaron did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites and to tell them that this is what the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone from the house of Israel slaughters a head of cattle or a sheep or a goat in the camp or slaughters it outside the camp
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without bringing it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting ⎣to sacrifice it for a burnt offering or fellowship offering to the Lord to be acceptable as a pleasant aroma, and if anyone slaughters it outside the camp and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting⎦ to present it as an offering to the Lord at the Dwelling of the Lord, guilt for blood will be charged to that man. He has shed blood. That man will be cut off from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is so that the Israelites will bring the sacrifices that they have been offering in the open country to the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, to the priest. They will sacrifice them as fellowship offerings to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the priest may splash the blood against the altar of the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and turn the fat into smoke as a pleasing aroma to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they no longer offer their sacrifices to the goat demons, to which they have been prostituting themselves. This shall be a permanent regulation for them throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them that if anyone from the house of Israel or from the aliens who reside among them offers up a burnt offering or a sacrifice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and does not bring it into the entrance to the Tent of Meeting to offer it to the Lord, that man will be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone from the house of Israel or from the aliens who reside among them eats any blood, I will set my face against the person who eats the blood, and I will cut him off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I myself have given it to you to make atonement for your lives upon the altar, because it is the blood that makes atonement by means of the life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I have said to the Israelites: None of you shall eat blood, nor shall any alien who resides among you eat blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of the Israelites or any alien who resides among them successfully hunts wild game and takes an animal or a bird that may be eaten, he must pour out its blood and cover it with earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the life of all flesh is its blood. It is its life. Therefore I have said to the Israelites: You shall not eat the blood from any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Whoever eats it will be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any person, whether native or alien, eats anything that has died naturally or has been torn by wild animals, he shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until sunset. Then he shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not wash his clothes and bathe his body, he shall bear his guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Speak to the Israelites and tell them this.”
I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not do as they do in the land of Egypt, where you lived. You shall not do as they do in the land of Canaan, to which I am bringing you. Do not walk in their religious practices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow my ordinances and keep my regulations by walking in them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep my regulations and my ordinances. Anyone who does them will have life through them. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall approach his own flesh and blood to uncover their nakedness. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness that is reserved for your father, that is, the nakedness of your mother. She is your mother. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife. It is nakedness that is reserved for your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your half-sister, whether she is your father’s daughter or your mother’s daughter, whether born in the household or outside it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter. That would be like uncovering your own nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nakedness of the daughter of your father’s wife, the adopted child of your father—she is your sister—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister. She has the same flesh as your father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister, because she is the same flesh as your mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother by approaching his wife. She is your aunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law. She is your son’s wife. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife. Her nakedness is reserved for your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of both a woman and her daughter. You shall not take her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter and so uncover nakedness that belongs to her. They are her flesh. It is a depraved act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not take a woman and then take her sister as a rival by uncovering her sister’s nakedness during that first wife’s lifetime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness during the period when she is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not give the wife of your fellow citizen your deposit of semen for seed, so that you become unclean with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not dedicate any of your seed to Molek, thereby defiling the name of your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not lie down with a male as you do with a woman. It is an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not give your emission to any animal, so that you become unclean by it. No woman shall stand in front of an animal to let it mate with her. It is an unnatural perversion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not make yourselves unclean in any of these ways, for in all these ways the nations that I am casting out before you have made themselves unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way the land became unclean, so I have come to deal with its guilt, and the land will vomit out its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you yourselves must keep my regulations and ordinances. You must not practice any of these abominations. This applies both to the native and to the alien who resides among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the people of the land who were there before you practiced all these abominations, the land became unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not let the land vomit you out for making it unclean, as it vomited out the nation that was there before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does any of these abominations, the lives of those who practice them will be cut off from the midst of their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep my instructions. Do not perform any of the abominable practices which were done before you arrived, so that you do not defile yourselves by them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to speak to the whole community of the Israelites and tell them these things:
You shall be holy, because I, the Lord your God, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of you must respect your mother and father and keep my Sabbaths. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not turn to gods that really are not gods. You must not make for yourselves gods cast out of metal. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you offer a sacrifice that is a fellowship offering to the Lord, you shall offer it so that you will be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is to be eaten on the day that you offer it or on the next day, but whatever is left over on the third day is to be burned in fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is eaten at all on the third day, it will be regarded as rotten meat. It is not acceptable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats it will bear his guilt, because he has desecrated what is holy to the Lord. Any such person will be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you reap the harvest from your land, you are not to finish reaping all the way to the edge of the field. Do not gather up the gleanings of your harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not strip your vineyard clean, and do not pick up the fallen grapes from your vineyard, but leave them for the poor and the alien who live with you. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not steal. You shall not swindle. You shall not lie to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not swear falsely by my name so that you do not profane the name of your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not exploit your neighbor. You shall not rob him. You shall not keep the wages of a day laborer with you overnight until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not curse a deaf person, nor shall you put an obstacle in front of a blind person, but you must fear your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not act unjustly in court cases. Do not show favoritism to a poor person, and do not show undue honor to an important person. You must judge your fellow citizens with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not go around spreading slander among your people. You shall not testify falsely against your neighbor in a capital case. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not hate a fellow Israelite in your heart. You must openly rebuke your fellow citizen so that you do not become responsible for his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not take revenge. You must not bear a grudge against the members of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep my regulations. You must not cause two different kinds of livestock to mate together. You must not sow your field with two kinds of seed. You must not wear any clothing made with two kinds of material.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies down with a woman and has an emission of semen, if she is a female slave who has already been designated for another man, but she has not yet been fully ransomed or received her freedom, a hearing shall be held concerning financial compensation, but they are not to be put to death, because she had not been freed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he must bring his restitution offering to the Lord at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting—a ram for restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall perform atonement on his behalf before the Lord with the ram for the restitution offering for his sin that he has committed, so that he may be forgiven for his sin that he has committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also when you enter the land and plant any kind of fruit tree, you must cut off its budding fruit as if it were a foreskin. For three years you shall regard the tree and its fruit as uncircumcised. Its fruit shall not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth year, all its fruit shall be set aside as a holy offering of praise to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat its fruit in the fifth year, so that its yield may be increased for you. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall not eat meat with the blood in it.
You shall not interpret omens, nor shall you perform divination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not round off the hair on the side of your heads, nor shall you disfigure the edge of your beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make a gash in your flesh for the dead, nor shall you put tattoos on yourselves. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not defile your daughter by making her a prostitute, so that the land will not be subjected to prostitution and filled with depravity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must keep my Sabbaths, and you must revere my sanctuary. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not turn to mediums or to spiritists and so become unclean through them. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must rise in the presence of gray hair and show respect in the presence of an elder, so that you fear your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When an alien resides with you in your land, you must not mistreat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall treat the alien who resides with you as a fellow citizen. You shall love him as yourself, for you were aliens in the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not use dishonest measurements of weight or volume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead you must use an honest scale, honest weights, an honest dry measure, and an honest liquid measure.
I am the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, you shall keep all my requirements and my ordinances and carry them out. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to say this to the Israelites:
Any Israelite or any of the aliens who reside in Israel who give any of their children to Molek must certainly be put to death. The people of the land shall stone that person to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will set my face against that person and cut him off from among his people, because when he gave some of his children to Molek, he made my sanctuary unclean and defiled my holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, if the people of the land deliberately shut their eyes when that man gives any of his children to Molek, and they do not put him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will set my face against that man and against his clan. I will cut off from among their people both that man and all those who join with him in prostituting themselves to Molek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any person turns to mediums or to spiritists and prostitutes himself to them, I will set my face against that person and cut him off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set yourselves apart, and you shall be holy, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep my regulations, and you shall put them into practice. I am the Lord, who has set you apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, if anybody curses his father and his mother, he must certainly be put to death. Since he has cursed his father and his mother, his blood is upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man commits adultery with the wife of another man, if he commits adultery with the wife of his neighbor, both the adulterer and the adulteress must certainly be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies down with his father’s wife, he has uncovered nakedness that is reserved for his father. Both of them certainly must be put to death. Their blood is upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies down with his daughter-in-law, both of them must be put to death. They have committed an unnatural perversion. Their blood is upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies down with a male as one lies down with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination. They must certainly be put to death. Their blood is upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man takes a woman and her mother, it is a depraved act. Both he and they shall be burned in fire, so that there may be no depravity among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man gives his emission to an animal, he must certainly be put to death, and you must kill the animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman approaches any animal to let it mate with her, you shall kill the woman and the animal. They must certainly be put to death. Their blood is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man takes his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother, and he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a shameful act. They will be cut off in the sight of their people. He has uncovered his sister’s nakedness. He will bear his guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies down with a woman during her period and uncovers her nakedness, he uncovers her flow, and she uncovers her flow of blood. Both of them will be cut off from the midst of their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or your father’s sister, for that would be uncovering one’s own flesh. They will bear their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies down with the wife of his father’s brother, he uncovers the nakedness that is reserved for his father’s brother. They shall bear their sin. They will die childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man takes his brother’s wife, it is a polluted act. He has uncovered nakedness that is reserved for his brother. They will remain childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep all my regulations and all my ordinances and put them into practice, so that the land to which I am bringing you to live will not vomit you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not walk according to the religious practices of the nation which I am casting out before you, for I was disgusted with them because they did all these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so I said to you, “You will take possession of their land. I myself will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey. I, the Lord, am your God, who has distinguished you from the other peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall therefore distinguish the clean animal from the unclean, and the unclean bird from the clean. You shall not make yourselves detestable with an animal or a bird or anything that crawls on the ground that I have distinguished by declaring what is unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be holy to me, for I, the Lord, am holy, and I have distinguished you from the other peoples so that you belong to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man or a woman who is a medium or deals with the spirits of the dead must certainly be put to death. They must be stoned to death. Their blood is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord told Moses to speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and tell them this:
No one shall make himself unclean for a dead person among his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except for his closest relatives. He may do it for his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, or his brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also for his virgin sister, who is close to him because she does not have a husband—for her he may make himself unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he shall not make himself unclean for his relatives by marriage and so defile himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests shall not cut a bald patch on to their heads or cut off the edges of their beards or gash their bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be holy to their God, and they shall not defile the name of their God. Because they present offerings made by fire, the food of their God, they are to be set apart as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not marry a woman who has been a prostitute or is defiled. Neither shall they marry a woman divorced from her husband, for each priest is holy to his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall treat him as holy. Since he presents the food of your God, he shall be holy to you, for I, the Lord, who sets you apart as holy, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the daughter of a man who is a priest defiles herself through prostitution, she is defiling her father. She shall be burned in fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest, who is greater than his brothers, on whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been ordained to wear the holy garments, shall not dishevel his hair nor tear his garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not enter any place where there is a dead person. He shall not make himself unclean even for his father or his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not leave the sanctuary, so that he will not defile the sanctuary of his God, for the mark of consecration with the anointing oil of his God is upon him. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest shall marry a woman who is a virgin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A widow or a divorcée or a woman defiled because of prostitution—these he shall not marry. Instead, he shall take a virgin from his own people as a wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he does not defile his offspring among his people, for I am the Lord, who sets him apart as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to tell Aaron this:
Any man from your offspring throughout their generations who has a defect may not approach to present the food of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, any man who has a defect shall not approach—a man who is blind or lame, or who has a limb that is too short or too long,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man who has a crippled foot or a crippled hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or who is deformed or abnormally small, or who has a growth in his eye, or a festering boil, or some other disfiguring skin condition, or a damaged testicle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any man among the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall not draw near to present the gifts of the Lord. He has a defect, so he shall not draw near to present the food of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he may eat the food of his God from the most holy things and from the holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, he shall not go in front of the veil and shall not approach the altar because he has a defect, so that he does not defile my holy things, for I am the Lord, who sets them apart as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron and his sons to be very careful with the holy things of the people of Israel, which they consecrate to me, so that they may not defile my holy name. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell them these things.”
In future generations, if any man among all your descendants, while he is in a state of uncleanness, approaches the holy things, which the Israelites consecrate to the Lord, that person is to be cut off from my presence. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Any man of Aaron’s descendants who has an impure skin disease or a bodily discharge shall not eat any of the holy things until he is clean.
Any man who touches anything made unclean by a dead person, or any man from whom an emission of semen goes out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or any man who touches any swarming creature that makes him unclean, or who touches any human being who makes him unclean, whatever his uncleanness might be—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that person who touches any of these things will be unclean until sunset and shall not eat any of the holy things unless he has washed his body with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun has gone down, he will be clean. After that he may eat from the holy things, for it is his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he shall not eat anything that has died naturally or been torn by wild animals, and so become unclean by it. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron’s descendants shall therefore keep watch for me, so that they do not become responsible for sin on account of uncleanness and die for it because they have defiled something holy. I am the Lord, who sets them apart as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No person who is not a member of a priest’s family may eat anything holy. No guest or employee of a priest may eat anything holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a priest purchases anyone with his money, that person may eat from it, and those who are born into his household may eat from his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a priest’s daughter has a husband who is not a priest, she may not eat any of the holy things that have been donated as an elevated offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a priest’s daughter is widowed or divorced and she has no children and returns to her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food. No person who is not a member of a priest’s family may eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone eats a holy thing unintentionally, he shall add one fifth of its value to it and give the holy thing to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests shall not defile the holy things that the Israelites donate as an elevated offering to the Lord
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by letting other people eat them and so make that person incur the penalty of a restitution offering for the holy things, because I am the Lord, who sets them apart as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to speak to Aaron and his sons and the whole people of Israel and tell them this:
Whenever anyone of the house of Israel or any of the aliens residing in Israel presents their offerings—whether it is any kind of offering to fulfill a vow or any kind of voluntary offering, which may be presented to the Lord as a burnt offering—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order for the offering to be accepted it must be a male without blemish, from the cattle or the sheep or the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not present any animal with a defect, because it will not be accepted on your behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone presents a sacrifice as a fellowship offering to the Lord from the herd or the flock to fulfill a vow or as a voluntary offering, it must be without blemish for it to be accepted on your behalf. There must not be any defect in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any animal that is blind, injured, or maimed, with a growth in the eye, a festering boil, or sores—these you shall not present to the Lord. You shall not put any of these on the altar as an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may, however, make a voluntary offering with a head of cattle or with a sheep or goat that has a long or short leg, but it will not be accepted as an offering to fulfill a vow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not present to the Lord any animal that has its testicles bruised or crushed or torn out or cut off. You shall not do this in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not present any of these animals from a foreigner as the food of your God. Because they are flawed, with a defect in them, they will not be accepted on your behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told Moses this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a calf or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall remain with its mother for seven days. From the eighth day on, it will be acceptable as an offering that is a gift made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall not slaughter a cow or a ewe with her young on the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the Lord, you shall sacrifice it so that you will be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be eaten on the same day. You shall not leave any of it over until the morning. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall keep my commandments by doing them. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall not defile my holy name, so that I may be honored as holy among the Israelites. I am the Lord, who sets you apart as holy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to speak to the Israelites and to tell them this:
These are the appointed times of the Lord, which you shall proclaim as holy convocations. These are my appointed times:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, a holy convocation. You shall not do any work. It shall be a sabbath to the Lord in all the places you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the appointed times of the Lord, the holy convocations which you shall proclaim at their appointed times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, is the Lord’s Passover,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fifteenth day of this month is the Festival of Unleavened Bread for the Lord. You shall eat unleavened bread for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day a holy convocation is to be proclaimed for you. You shall not do any work in your regular occupation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall present an offering by fire to the Lord for seven days. The seventh day shall be proclaimed as a holy convocation. You shall not do any work for your regular occupation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to speak to the people of Israel and tell them this:
When you enter the land that I am giving to you and you reap its harvest, and when you bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he may wave the sheaf before the Lord so that you will be accepted, the priest shall wave it on the day after the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day that you wave the sheaf, you shall offer as a burnt offering to the Lord a lamb without blemish, one year old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grain offering accompanying it is to be four quarts of fine wheat flour mixed with oil, a gift to the Lord, a pleasing aroma. The drink offering accompanying it shall be a quart of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not eat any of this year’s bread or roasted grain or fresh ears until this very day, until you have brought the offering of your God. This is a permanent regulation throughout your generations in all the places you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then from the day after the Sabbath, from the day that you bring the sheaf to be waved, you shall count off seven weeks for yourselves. They must be complete weeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall count fifty days, until you reach the day after the seventh Sabbath. Then you shall present an offering of new grain to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the places where you live you shall bring two loaves of bread as a wave offering. They shall be made of four quarts of fine wheat flour, baked with yeast, as first ripe produce for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then with the bread you shall present seven lambs without blemish, each of them one year old, one young bull from the herd, and two rams—they shall be a whole burnt offering for the Lord, together with their grain offerings and their drink offerings, an offering made by fire, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also present the sin offering with one male goat and the fellowship offering with two one-year-old male lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall wave them, together with the bread from the first ripe produce, as a wave offering before the Lord, in addition to the two lambs. They shall be holy to the Lord for the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this very same day you shall make a proclamation. A holy convocation will be proclaimed for you. You shall do no work in your regular occupation. This is a permanent regulation in all the places you live throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not completely reap the edges of your field or gather the dropped stalks from your harvest. You shall leave them for the poor and for the resident alien. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to speak to the people of Israel:
In the seventh month, on the first of the month, you shall have a complete rest, a memorial celebration with loud blasts of the ram’s horn, proclaimed as a holy convocation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not do any work in your regular occupation, and you shall present a gift made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the tenth day of this seventh month that is the Day of Atonement. It shall be proclaimed as a holy convocation for you. You shall humble yourselves, and you shall present an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not do any work on this special day, because it is the Day of Atonement, to make atonement for you before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, anyone who does not humble himself on this special day will be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does any work on this very special day, I will exterminate from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do no work. This is a permanent regulation throughout your generations in all your places where you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sabbath of complete rest for you. You shall humble yourselves on the ninth day of the month at evening. From that evening until the next evening, you shall observe a sabbath rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to tell the people of Israel this:
Beginning on the fifteenth day of this seventh month, celebrate the Festival of Shelters for seven days for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day proclaim a holy convocation. You shall not do any work for your regular occupation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you shall bring an offering made by fire to the Lord. On the eighth day proclaim a holy convocation for yourselves, and you shall present an offering made by fire to the Lord. This is a closing ceremony. You shall not do any work for your regular occupation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the appointed times of the Lord, which you shall proclaim as holy convocations for the presentation of offerings made by fire to the Lord—burnt offerings and grain offerings, sacrifices and drink offerings as commanded for each day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Offer these in addition to the Sabbath offerings of the Lord, in addition to your personal wave offerings, in addition to all your offerings to fulfill a vow, and in addition to all your voluntary offerings that you give to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beginning exactly on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the produce of the land, when you go to celebrate the festival of the Lord for seven days as a pilgrim, there shall be a complete sabbath rest on the first day and a complete sabbath rest on the eighth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day you shall select for yourselves fruit from splendid trees, branches of palm trees, boughs from leafy trees, and willows from by the stream—and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Celebrate the festival for the Lord as a pilgrim for seven days each year. This is a permanent regulation throughout your generations. In the seventh month you shall celebrate the festival as a pilgrim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall live in temporary shelters for seven days—every native-born person in Israel shall live in shelters—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your generations may know that I made the people of Israel live in shelters when I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is what Moses said about the appointed times of the Lord to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the Israelites to bring you clear oil from beaten olives for the Light so the lamps will be kept burning continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall set the Light before the Lord in the Tent of Meeting, outside the veil which is in front of the Testimony, every night from the evening to the morning. It is a permanent regulation throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall set the lamps regularly on the pure gold lampstand before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take fine flour and bake twelve round loaves from it. Each loaf shall be made with four quarts of flour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them in two stacks, six to each stack, on the pure gold table before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Upon the stacks you shall place clear frankincense as a memorial portion for the bread. It is a gift of food to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On every Sabbath day he shall arrange it before the Lord regularly. It is a permanent covenant on behalf of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bread shall belong to Aaron and his sons, who shall eat it in a holy place, for it belongs to him as a most holy thing from the gifts of food to the Lord, a perpetual allotment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man who was the son of an Israelite woman and of an Egyptian man came along with the Israelites. This son of the Israelite woman fought with another Israelite in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the Name and cursed, so they brought him to Moses. (His mother’s name was Shelomith, daughter of Dibri, belonging to the tribe of Dan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put him in custody to wait for a decision from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the man who cursed outside the camp, and all those who heard it shall lay their hands on his head, and the whole community shall stone him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then speak to the Israelites: If anyone curses his God, he shall bear his sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if anyone blasphemes the name of the Lord, he must certainly be put to death; the whole community must stone him. Whether he is an alien or a citizen, when he has blasphemed the Name, he must be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone hits someone and kills him, he must certainly be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one who strikes and kills an animal must make restitution for it, a life for a life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone injures his fellow citizen, he shall have the same thing done to him as he has done:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. As he injured that other person, the same is to be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One who strikes an animal so that it dies shall make restitution for it, but one who strikes a human being and kills him shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have the same standard of justice for the alien who lives with you and for the citizen, for I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Moses had spoken this to the Israelites, the man who had cursed was taken outside the camp and stoned to death. The Israelites did as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses at Mount Sinai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Speak to the Israelites and say this to them.”
When you enter the land that I am giving to you, the land shall observe a sabbath rest for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six years you may sow your field, and for six years you may prune your vineyard and gather its produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the seventh year there shall be a sabbath of complete rest for the land, a sabbath for the Lord. You shall not sow your field, and you shall not prune your vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not reap the produce that grows by itself from your harvest or gather the grapes from your unpruned vine. It shall be a year of complete rest for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sabbath of the land will, however, provide food for you—for you, for your male slaves and for your female slaves, for your hired workers and for your servants who are living with you temporarily as aliens working for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for your livestock and for the wild animals which are in your land. You may eat all its produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall count off seven weeks of years. Count off seven years seven times, so that the duration of the seven weeks of years is forty-nine years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall sound loud blasts on the ram’s horn. In the seventh month on the tenth day, on the Day of Atonement, you are to have a ram’s horn sounded throughout your land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may set aside the fiftieth year as holy and proclaim liberty throughout the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be a Jubilee for you, so that each of you may return to his family property and each of you may return to his clan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fiftieth year shall be a Jubilee for you. You shall not sow the field, and you shall not reap the grain that grows by itself, and you shall not gather fruit from its unpruned vines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it is a Jubilee, it shall be holy for you. You may eat its produce from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his family property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sell some land to your countryman, or when you buy land from your countryman, you must not cheat your brother Israelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you buy from your countryman, set the price according to the number of years since the last Jubilee. When he sells it to you, he shall set the price according to the number of years of produce left till the next Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When there are many years left, you shall increase the purchase price. When there are few years left, you shall decrease its purchase price, because what the owner is actually selling to you is the amount of produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So each of you must not cheat your countryman, but you shall fear your God, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall carry out my regulations, and you shall observe my ordinances. You shall carry them out, so that you may live on the land securely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land will yield its fruit, and you will eat your fill and live securely on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask, “What will we eat during the seventh year, since we may not sow and we may not gather our produce?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will command my blessing for you in the sixth year, so that the land will yield enough produce for three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sow in the eighth year, you will still be eating from the sixth year’s crop. You will eat the sixth year’s crop until the ninth year, when its produce comes in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land must not be sold without a right to recover it, for the land really belongs to me. You are actually resident aliens under my authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, throughout all the land that you possess, you shall grant the right of redemption for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your brother Israelite becomes so impoverished that he has to sell some of the land that he holds, his closest relative shall come and redeem what his brother has sold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man who has no close relative prospers and acquires enough for the price to redeem his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he may calculate the years since he sold it, refund the difference to the man to whom he sold it, and return to his family property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not acquire a sufficient amount to recover the land for himself, what he has sold shall remain under the control of the one who bought it until the year of Jubilee. It shall become free in the Jubilee, so that the seller may return to his family property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man sells a house where he lives in a walled town, his right of redemption shall last until a full year after its sale. The time to redeem it lasts for a year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is not redeemed before the completion of a full year, the house which is in a town which has a wall will belong to its buyer and his descendants. It cannot be reclaimed. It will not be released in the Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the houses in the villages that have no wall around them shall be classified as part of the farmland. They have the right of redemption and shall become free in the Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the towns of the Levites and the houses in the towns which are their property have a permanent right of redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever a Levite is permitted to redeem (such as a house which he sold that had been his property in a city) will become free in the Jubilee, because the houses in the towns of the Levites are their possession among the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the pastures and fields around the Levites’ towns may not be sold, for that is their permanent possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your fellow Israelite becomes so impoverished that he cannot support himself, help him as you would help a resident alien or a temporary resident. Let him retain his right to work for a livelihood among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not take advance interest or accrued interest from him, but you shall fear your God and let your brother retain his livelihood with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not lend him your money for advance interest or your food for accrued interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who freed you from the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your fellow Israelite becomes so indebted to you that he is sold to you, you shall not make him serve as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall remain with you as a hired laborer or a temporary resident. He shall work for you until the year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he and his children with him will become free from your authority. He shall return to his family home and to his ancestral landholding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Israelites are my servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt. They shall not be sold in a slave sale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not rule over them harshly, but you shall fear your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may buy a male slave or a female slave for yourself from the nations around you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may also buy some of the children of those who reside as aliens among you and some of their extended families who are born in your land, so that they become your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may leave them to your children as inherited property. You may make them work as slaves for life. But as for your brothers, the Israelites, each of you must not rule over your brother harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a resident alien living among you prospers, and if your brother Israelite becomes so indebted to him that he is sold to that alien living among you or to that alien’s family,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Israelite who has been sold shall have the right to be redeemed. One of his brothers may redeem him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or his uncle or his cousin may redeem him, or anyone from his immediate family or extended family may redeem him, or if he prospers, he may redeem himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Together with his buyer, he shall calculate the elapsed time from the year that he was sold until the year of Jubilee, and the price to redeem him shall be based on that number of years. It shall be calculated as if he were a hired laborer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there are still many years left, he shall pay the price of redemption proportionally to the years that have passed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only a few years remain until the year of Jubilee, he shall calculate the redemption in this way: He shall pay the price of his redemption on the basis of his years of work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as if he were a worker hired year by year. You shall see to it that the owner does not rule over him harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has not been redeemed in any of these ways, he and his children with him shall become free in the year of Jubilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Israelites are servants who really belong to me. They are my servants whom I freed from the land of Egypt. I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make gods that are really not gods for yourselves, and you shall not set up an image or a sacred memorial stone for yourselves, and you shall not set up a carved stone relief in your land to bow down to it, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall observe my Sabbaths and revere my sanctuary. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you walk according to my regulations and keep my commandments and carry them out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you rains in their season, so that the land will yield its produce and the trees in the farmland will yield their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Threshing will last until the grape harvest, and the grape harvest will last until the time for sowing. You will eat your food until you are full, and you will live securely in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give peace in the land so that you may lie down without anyone frightening you. I will eliminate ferocious animals from the land, and no sword will pass through your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will pursue your enemies, and they will fall before you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of you will pursue a hundred, and a hundred of you will pursue ten thousand, and your enemies will fall before you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will look on you with favor, and I will make you fruitful and will multiply you, and I will keep my covenant with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat grain from previous harvests, grain long stored, until you remove the old grain to make room for the new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will place my Dwelling in your midst, and I will not at all detest you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will walk about in your midst, and I will be your God, and you will be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who freed you from the land of Egypt so that you would not be slaves to them. I broke the bars of your yoke so that I could make you walk upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to me and do not obey all these commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you reject my regulations and you detest my ordinances so much that you do not obey all my commandments, so that you break my covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in turn will do this to you: I will inflict upon you panic, wasting disease, and fever, which will cause your eyes to fail and your vitality to slip away. You will sow your seed but get no return, for your enemies will eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set my face against you. You will be beaten by your enemies, and those who hate you will rule over you. You will flee, even though nobody is pursuing you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, despite these things, you will not listen to me, I will go on to discipline you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will break your proud strength and make your sky like iron and your land as hard as bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your strength will be exhausted without accomplishing anything. Your land will not yield its produce, and the trees on the land will not yield their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you still remain hostile to me and you are not willing to listen to me, I will multiply the plague against you seven times more according to your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send against you the wild animals so that they will deprive you of your children and cut off your livestock. They will make you so few that your roads will be deserted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If in spite of all these things you still refuse to be disciplined by me, and you remain hostile to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also remain hostile to you. I will strike you seven times more for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring a sword on you to avenge the covenant. If you withdraw into your towns, I will send an epidemic among you, so that you will be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I break your supply of bread, ten women will bake your bread in a single oven. They will have to ration your bread, and though you eat, you will not be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, in spite of all this, you will not listen to me and remain hostile to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will remain hostile to you in anger. I myself will discipline you seven times as much for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will destroy your high places, cut down your incense burners, and place your corpses on the corpses of your filthy idols. With all my heart I will detest you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will turn your towns into a wasteland and make your holy places desolate, and I will not smell the pleasing aroma of your sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will make your land so desolate that your enemies who settle in it will be appalled at it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while I scatter you among the nations and unsheathe my sword against you. Then your land will be a desolation, and your towns will be a wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land will then enjoy its sabbaths during all the days of its desolation, while you are in the land of your enemies. Yes, the land will rest and enjoy its sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days when it is desolate it will rest, because it did not rest on your sabbaths when you lived there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for those of you who survive, I will bring despair into their hearts in the lands of their enemies, so that the sound of a scattered leaf will scare them away. They will flee as though fleeing from a sword, and they will fall though no one is pursuing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of them will stumble over his brother, as if from a sword, even though no one is pursuing him. You will have no power to stand against your enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will perish among the nations. The land of your enemies will devour you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those of you who survive will rot away in the lands of your enemies because of their guilt. They will rot away because of the guilt of their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will confess their guilt and the guilt of their ancestors because of the unfaithfulness that they committed against me, and also because they remained hostile to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I in turn became hostile to them, and I brought them into the land of their enemies. So their uncircumcised hearts will then be humbled, and they will then accept the punishment for their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will remember my covenant with Jacob. I will remember also my covenant with Isaac and my covenant with Abraham as well. I will remember the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land will be empty of them, so that in its desolation it may enjoy its sabbaths without them, while they suffer punishment for their guilt, because, and only because, they rejected my ordinances and they detested my statutes with all their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet, for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them, and I will not detest them so much that I exterminate them. I will not annul my covenant with them, for I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will remember in their favor the covenant to be their God that I made with their first generation, whom I freed from the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations. I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the regulations, the ordinances, and the laws that the Lord instituted between himself and the people of Israel at Mount Sinai through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Speak to the Israelites and say this to them.”
When a person makes a special vow to the Lord which is based on the value of different classes of people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the set value of a male from twenty years to sixty years of age is fifty shekels of silver, using the sanctuary shekel as the standard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is a female, the value is thirty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the age is from five years to twenty years, the value is twenty shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the age is from one month to five years, the value for the male is five shekels of silver, while the value for the female is three shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the age is sixty years or over, the value is fifteen shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone making a dedication is too poor to pay that standard value, he shall appear before the priest with the dedicated person, and the priest shall assess a substitute valuation for the person. The priest shall assess a value on the basis of what the person who has made the vow can afford.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If what is vowed is livestock which is acceptable as an offering to the Lord, anything that a person dedicates to the Lord is set apart as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may not exchange it or substitute another for it, either good for bad, or bad for good. If he substitutes one animal for another, both the animal and its substitute are set aside as holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If what has been vowed is any kind of unclean livestock, which may not be presented as an offering to the Lord, he shall present the animal before the priest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the priest may assess it. Whatever value is set by the priest, whether high or low, will be binding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does indeed redeem it, he must add one-fifth to its value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a person dedicates his house as holy to the Lord, the priest shall assess it. Whatever value the priest assesses, whether high or low, will be binding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the person who has dedicated his house redeems it, he must add one-fifth to its value in silver, so that it belongs to him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person dedicates any field from his family property to the Lord, its value shall be based on how much seed is needed to sow it. Land sown by six bushels of barley seed is worth fifty shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he dedicates his field during the year of Jubilee, its value stands as stated,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if he dedicates his field after the Jubilee, the priest shall recalculate its value in silver based on the number of years that are left until the next year of Jubilee, and that much will be deducted from the value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person who dedicated the field redeems it, he must add one-fifth to its value in silver, so that it may be returned to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not redeem the field but has sold the field to another person, it may no longer be redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the field is released on the Jubilee, it will be set aside as holy. It belongs to the Lord as a dedicated field. It belongs to the priest as his holding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone dedicates to the Lord a field he has purchased that is not part of his family landholding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest shall calculate the amount of value until the year of Jubilee, so that he may pay the value on that day as something holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the year of Jubilee, the field shall return to the person from whom the donor bought it, to the one to whom the landholding originally belonged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every value shall be based on the sanctuary shekel, which has twenty gerahs to the shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, no one may dedicate a firstborn from the livestock that has already been designated for the Lord as a firstborn, whether it is a head of cattle or a sheep or a goat. It already belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is one of the unclean livestock, he may buy it back at its set value plus one-fifth. If it is not redeemed, it may be sold at its set value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if anyone devotes anything that belongs to him to the Lord unconditionally, whether it is a human being or livestock or any part of his landholding, it may not be sold and may not be redeemed. Everything devoted unconditionally is most holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any person who has been devoted to destruction may not be ransomed. He must certainly be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every tithe from the land, whether from the seed of the land or from the fruit of the trees, belongs to the Lord. It is holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone redeems any of his tithe, he must add one-fifth to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tithe from the herd or the flock, that is, every tenth animal that passes under the staff of the shepherd, shall be set apart as holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donor must not sort out the good from the bad, and he must not make any substitutions for it. If he makes a substitution for it, then both the first animal and its substitute shall be set apart as holy. It cannot be redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments that the Lord commanded Moses for the people of Israel at Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator
